Comment: Napoleon decides to kick off with Reti. Nf3
The general responds with Nc6. Seems odd because he should give his c-pawn the option to be played to c5 but it's still resonable.
e4 comes instead. i recommend continueing with c4 or g3.
And now suddenly it transposes. Now they might as well have played 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6.
The Scottish opening was very common back then. People usually enjoyed to be offensive at the 19th century and scottish was an offensive move.

weak. But the general wasn't considered to be a great chess player anyways. Now after 4. Nxd4 exd4 5. Qxd4 white has managed to centralize a strong queen in the center. Queens should normally not be played early in the opening if they will get knocked back with tempo but the queen wont be knocked back on d4 that easily.
I think 4. Nxe5 was possibly even better.
Bc4?! not necessarily a poor move. Napoleon did see Qxd4 but he decides to gambit that pawn for a better development.
